showScoreExcerpt:
"This show so overstuffs itself with gags, one-liners and visual diversions that you shut down from sensory overload...Brightman and 'Beetlejuice' can indeed sustain this anything-for-a-laugh intensity. And it is not a trait that benefits from prolonged exposure...Here, everybody, including every member of the support cast, has already gone so far over the top that thereâ€™s no room for comic contrast. The disheartening moral of 'Beetlejuice' is that when anything goes, nothing much registers."
